mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn55.7:4.7.pli: Yo kho myāyaṁ dhammo appiyo amanāpo, kathāhaṁ paraṁ tena saṁyojeyyan’ti.
sn55.7:4.7.en: Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on someone else?’

sn55.7:5.5.pli: Yo kho myāyaṁ dhammo appiyo amanāpo, kathāhaṁ paraṁ tena saṁyojeyyan’ti.
sn55.7:5.5.en: Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on someone else?’

sn55.7:6.5.pli: Yo kho myāyaṁ dhammo appiyo amanāpo, kathāhaṁ paraṁ tena saṁyojeyyan’ti.
sn55.7:6.5.en: Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on others?’

sn55.7:7.5.pli: Yo kho myāyaṁ dhammo appiyo amanāpo, kathāhaṁ paraṁ tena saṁyojeyyan’ti.
sn55.7:7.5.en: Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on others?’

sn55.7:10.5.pli: Yo kho myāyaṁ dhammo appiyo amanāpo, kathāhaṁ paraṁ tena saṁyojeyyan’ti.
sn55.7:10.5.en: Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on another?’

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 55.7
1. At Bamboo Gate
The People of Bamboo Gate

mn105:18.2.pli: ‘taṇhā kho sallaṁ samaṇena vuttaṁ, avijjāvisadoso, chandarāgabyāpādena ruppati.
mn105:18.2.en: ‘The Ascetic has said that craving is a dart; and that the poison of ignorance is inflicted by desire and ill will.

mn105:21.2.pli: ‘taṇhā kho sallaṁ samaṇena vuttaṁ, avijjāvisadoso chandarāgabyāpādena ruppati.
mn105:21.2.en: ‘The Ascetic has said that craving is a dart; and that the poison of ignorance is inflicted by desire and ill will.

mn105:26.2.en: ‘The Ascetic has said that craving is a dart; and that the poison of ignorance is inflicted by desire and ill will.

sn42.13:7.6.pli: tena naṁ rājāno gahetvā evarūpaṁ kammakāraṇaṁ kārentī’ti.
sn42.13:7.6.en: That’s why the rulers arrested him and inflicted such punishment.’

sn42.13:10.5.pli: Tena naṁ rājāno gahetvā evarūpaṁ kammakāraṇaṁ kārentī’ti.
sn42.13:10.5.en: That’s why the rulers arrested him and inflicted such punishment.’

sn42.13:12.6.pli: tena naṁ rājāno gahetvā evarūpaṁ kammakāraṇaṁ kārentī’ti.
sn42.13:12.6.en: That’s why the rulers arrested him and inflicted such punishment.’

sn42.13:14.6.pli: tena naṁ rājāno gahetvā evarūpaṁ kammakāraṇaṁ kārentī’ti.
sn42.13:14.6.en: That’s why the rulers arrested him and inflicted such punishment.’

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn129:4.4.pli: ‘yathārūpānaṁ kho pāpakānaṁ kammānaṁ hetu rājāno coraṁ āgucāriṁ gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti—
mn129:4.4.en: ‘The kinds of deeds for which the kings inflict such punishments—

mn129:4.7.pli: Mañcepi rājāno jāneyyuṁ, mampi rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kāreyyuṁ—
mn129:4.7.en: If the kings find out about me, they will inflict the same kinds of punishments on me!’

mn129:29.4.pli: ‘yathārūpānaṁ kho pāpakānaṁ kammānaṁ hetu rājāno coraṁ āgucāriṁ gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārenti kasāhipi tāḷenti, vettehipi tāḷenti, addhadaṇḍakehipi tāḷenti, hatthampi chindanti, pādampi chindanti, hatthapādampi chindanti, kaṇṇampi chindanti, nāsampi chindanti, kaṇṇanāsampi chindanti, bilaṅgathālikampi karonti, saṅkhamuṇḍikampi karonti, rāhumukhampi karonti, jotimālikampi karonti, hatthapajjotikampi karonti, erakavattikampi karonti, cīrakavāsikampi karonti, eṇeyyakampi karonti, balisamaṁsikampi karonti, kahāpaṇikampi karonti, khārāpatacchikampi karonti, palighaparivattikampi karonti, palālapīṭhakampi karonti, tattenapi telena osiñcanti, sunakhehipi khādāpenti, jīvantampi sūle uttāsenti, asināpi sīsaṁ chindanti, na te dhammā mayi saṁvijjanti, ahañca na tesu dhammesu sandissāmī’ti.
mn129:29.4.en: ‘The kinds of deeds for which the kings inflict such punishments—those things are not found in me and I do not exhibit them!’

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 129
The Foolish and the Astute

dn3:1.26.3.pli: idha brāhmaṇā brāhmaṇaṁ kismiñcideva pakaraṇe khuramuṇḍaṁ karitvā bhassapuṭena vadhitvā raṭṭhā vā nagarā vā pabbājeyyuṁ.
dn3:1.26.3.en: Suppose the brahmins for some reason were to shave a brahmin’s head, inflict him with a sack of ashes, and banish him from the nation or the city.

dn3:1.27.2.pli: idha khattiyā khattiyaṁ kismiñcideva pakaraṇe khuramuṇḍaṁ karitvā bhassapuṭena vadhitvā raṭṭhā vā nagarā vā pabbājeyyuṁ.
dn3:1.27.2.en: Suppose the aristocrats for some reason were to shave an aristocrat’s head, inflict him with a sack of ashes, and banish him from the nation or the city.

dn3:1.27.11.pli: “Ettāvatā kho, ambaṭṭha, khattiyo paramanihīnataṁ patto hoti, yadeva naṁ khattiyā khuramuṇḍaṁ karitvā bhassapuṭena vadhitvā raṭṭhā vā nagarā vā pabbājenti.
dn3:1.27.11.en: “At this point, Ambaṭṭha, that aristocrat has reached rock bottom, with head shaven, inflicted with a sack of ashes, and banished from city or nation.
